intro: Calycolpus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered calycolpus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a glossy, dark green appearance. The small, fragrant flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are borne in clusters, making it an attractive plant for ornamental purposes.
